Check your statement on minimum payment. For some banks  min. payment of eg. $50 means any amount $50 or below must be paid in full. If bill is more than $50  unpaid balance will roll over with interest.
UOB is under $10 to trigger GIRO payment and late fee. Some is under $20 or $50.

Hi  since 31st October is a public holiday  should I transfer out my HSBC EGA funds tomorrow as 31st is a non-business day?
Lol i suddenly thought of this as well a minute ago  and wanted to ask exactly the same question
Since 31st is PH  it wont affect the MAB of HSBC  and at same time  it allows u to use your transferable limit over 2 days (31st and 1st) for sums >250k. My understanding correct?
You want to reset HSBC ega balance? If so yes.
Yes. Is there a time that I must transfer out by?
Different banks have different cutoff time but do before 9pm to be safe.
Provided you donâ€™t get stuck and need HSBC anti fraud team to call u
If they suspect fraud especially if it involve different names and big amounts  they can stop the transfer out.
Do you plan to transfer it back in November? If yes  next month is special. If you look at TBill n SSB  all rates are fallen. What is your plan if the new EGA interest rate is not attractive to you?
I'm planning to put it back to my OCBC 360 in Nov. I have less than 100k so I am getting 3.85%. I will put back into HSBC EGA in Dec.
